# Developments

Causal inference literature, following developments are gaining popularity:

## TMLE

-   Pang et al. 2016 Epidemiology
-   Pang et al. 2016 Int. J Biostat.
-   Ju et al. 2019 Stat Meth Med Res.

::: column-margin
-   Parametric versions implemented
-   Super learner could be very time consuming

[@pang2016targeted; @pang2016effect; @ju2019scalable]
:::

## Super learner

-   Wyss et al. 2018 Epidemiology
-   Ju et al. 2019 J App Stat.

::: column-margin
-   Parametric versions implemented, or
-   Bias not used as a performance measure

[@ju2019propensity; @wyss2018using]
:::

## Cross-validation

-   [Naimi et al. (2021) Am J Epidemiol.](https://doi.org/10.1093/aje/kwab201)
    -   TMLE not performing as well
-   [Balzer Westling (2021) Am J Epidemiol.](https://doi.org/10.1093/aje/kwab200)


::: column-margin
[@naimi2017challenges; @balzer2021demystifying]
:::

## Super learner guideline

-   [Phillips et al. 2023 Int J Epidemiol.](https://doi.org/10.1093/ije/dyad023)

::: column-margin
[@Phillips2021]
:::

## Cross-fitting and double robust

[Zivich and Breskin (2021)](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/33591058/): Cross-fitting + together with double robust approaches in low-dimensional setting

::: column-margin
[@zivich2021machine]
:::
